appleIPSTooltip: When turned on, it allows the user to obtain indoor positions based on Apple’s indoor positioning, provided this is available and the user is on an iOS device.
browseServiceHeading: Choose an indoor positioning data service
gnssTooltip: When turned on, it allows the user to obtain GNSS based positions while being outdoors. Note: For a smoother switch from indoor positioning to GNSS positioning, include a Transitions layer in the IPS-aware map with entrance and exit transition features.
pathSnappingTooltip: When turned on, the user’s position indicator snaps to the Pathways line features that are configured for ArcGIS IPS and are within the set distance. Note: For path snapping to work, ensure that the IPS-aware map contains a Pathways layer with pathway features reserved for use with indoor positioning.
smoothingTooltip: When turned on, it smoothens the movement of the position indicator in case of abrupt changes in direction, speed and position.
